questions.question: Citizens must abide …………………. the law of the land.
questions.description: To abide by a rule is to respect it.

questions.question: Mother asked me to account …………………………… the amount of time I was away.
questions.description: To account for is to explain.

questions.question: Your theories just do not add ……………………………
questions.description: When explanations add up, they make sense.

questions.question: She advised me ………………………… taking public transport at odd hours.
questions.description: To advise against something is to recommend not doing it.

questions.question: I do not agree …………………………. you on this.
questions.description: When you agree with someone, you have the same opinion as them.

questions.question: We must allow .................................. potential issues that could hamper the project.
questions.description: To allow for something is to take that into consideration.

questions.question: Beach holidays just do not appeal ............................... me.
questions.description: If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.

questions.question: The child was told to go to his room so that he could calm ……………………………….
questions.description: To calm down is to relax after being angry.

questions.question: If you want to catch ………………………… them, you have to work twice as hard.
None of the invitees turned ……………………..
questions.description: To turn up is to appear.

questions.question: I never thought that the plan would work …………………….. but it did.
questions.description: To work out is to become successful.

questions.question: I asked him to stop but he kept ………………………… running.
questions.description: To keep on is to continue.
